comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: I think it's this fellow: "The Right Reverend George Henry Somerset Walpole (9 November 1854 – 4 March 1929) was an Anglican priest, teacher and author. After early service in the west of England he moved first to Auckland, New Zealand, and then to New York, before returning to England. After educational work in Durham and pastoral work in London he was elected Bishop of Edinburgh in 1910, and held the post until his death." en.wikipedia.org/wiki/George_Walpole Dorothea Elizabeth Walpole (2/20/1887-11/16/1959) became a medical doctor in 1925 at the age of 38. Here is a detailed obituary: europepmc.org/articles/PMC1991424/pdf/brmedj02948-0094a.pdf and see: news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2507&dat=19620611&... This account has Bishop Walpole and his daughter (identified as Elise) arriving in New York aboard the Holland-America Line's SS Noordam on December 18, 1915. chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1915-12-19/ed-... More on the Noordam: cruise.bwatts.org/HAL22808/Noordamhistory.htm Her brother was the novelist Sir Hugh Walpole en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hugh_Walpole

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thank you for your excellent research and citations, artolog. We will add some of this information to the record the next time we update.
